unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Interest in India**
normalised: **Energy and Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Interest in India**

unnormalised: Good news, folks! Getting solar panels on your chhat (roof) just got easier, thanks to beefed-up subsidies from the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE). These subsidies, aimed at encouraging rooftop solar adoption, are proving popular from Mumbai to Madurai.
normalised: Good news, folks! Getting solar panels on your chhat (roof) just got easier, thanks to beefed-up subsidies from the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E). These subsidies, aimed at encouraging rooftop solar adoption, are proving popular from Mumbai to Madurai.

unnormalised: Under the revised scheme, homeowners can get up to 40% subsidy for systems up to 3 kW. Even for larger systems, there are savings. For anything above 3 kW and up to 10 kW, subsidies are capped.
normalised: Under the revised scheme, homeowners can get up to forty percent subsidy for systems up to three kilowatts. Even for larger systems, there are savings. For anything above three kilowatts and up to ten kilowatts, subsidies are capped.

unnormalised: "This is a great initiative," says Dr. Sharma, a solar energy expert from IIT Delhi. "It makes solar more affordable, especially for middle-class families looking to cut their electricity bills."
normalised: "This is a great initiative," says Doctor Sharma, a solar energy expert from I I T Delhi. "It makes solar more affordable, especially for middle-class families looking to cut their electricity bills."

unnormalised: Several states are also adding their own incentives on top of the central subsidy, sweetening the deal further. Think of it as a Diwali bonus for your wallet and the planet! Imagine covering your 1500 sq ft rooftop with panels.
normalised: Several states are also adding their own incentives on top of the central subsidy, sweetening the deal further. Think of it as a Diwali bonus for your wallet and the planet! Imagine covering your one thousand five hundred square feet rooftop with panels.
